titleInfo.title: Letter from Peter Elwin Wrench, Robert Garden, and Dymoke Lyster, Agent and Council at Bussora [Basra], to Benjamin Jervis, East India Company Resident at Bushire

mods.abstract: The letter main part of the letter discusses the idea of assisting the Caun [Karim Khan] against Meer Mahanna [Mīr Muhanna] following a request from Jervis for the Tartarto be sent to do so. The author argues that the coming monsoon, the condition of the vessel, and the risk of upsetting Mīr Muhanna all mean that the Tartarshould be dispatched to India immediately. It is also questioned why no copy of Karim Khan's letter requesting this assistance was sent to the Agency at Basra.The instruction to sell a tranky and notification of two sepoys travelling to Bushire are also given.
